channel.title: Eritque Arcus Math Notes
channel.description: Last 10 notes on Eritque Arcus Math Notes

item.title: readme
item.description: This part of website are some random notes I made for some advance mathematics courses I took.

item.title: readme
item.description: This note is outcome of Spring 25 CS 450. Numerical Analysis in UIUC taught by instructor Paul Fischer.

item.title: Newton's method - multi
item.description: Concept x_{k + 1} = x_k - J^{-1}(x_k)f(x_k) where J is Jacobian matrix [J(x_k)]_{ij} = \left[\frac{\partial f(x_i)}{\partial x_j}\right].

item.title: inverse quadratic interpolation
item.description: Concept for every iteration u=f(b)/f(c), v = f(b)/f(a), w = f(a)/f(c) p = v(w(u-w)(c-b - (1-u)(b-a))) q = (w-1)(u-1)(v-1) then c = a, a = b and b = b + p.

item.title: Newton's method
item.description: Concept x_{k + 1} = x_k - \frac{f(x_k)}{f'(x_k)} sometime we use g(x) g(x) = x - \frac{f(x)}{f'(x)} and g'(x) = \frac{f(x)f''(x)}{f'(x)^2} Examples \frac{1}{A} f(x) = A - \frac{1}{x} then f(\frac{1}{A}) = 0.

item.title: Aitken's method
item.description: Concept y_{k+2} = x_{k+2} - \frac{\Delta_2^2}{\Delta_2 - \Delta_1} where \Delta_1 = x_{k + 1} - x_k \Delta_2 = x_{k + 2} - x_{k + 1} this method is used to accelerating linearly converge for k = 0, 2, 4, ..

item.title: multipicity
item.description: If f(x^*) = f'(x^*) = f''(x^*) = \cdots = f^{(m - 1)}(x^*) = 0 and f^{(m)}(x^*) \neq 0, we can say x^* is a solution with multiplicity of m.

item.title: bisection
item.description: Concept m = a + (b - a )/2 and if sign(f(a)) == sign(f(m)), a = m else b = m rate it should has linear convergence rate since the interval cut half every iteration and C = 0.5.

item.title: convergence rate
item.description: sequence converges rate if \lim_{k\to \infty} \frac{||e_{k+1}||}{||e_k||^r} = C where C is finite nonzero constant, we can say it converges with rate r and r = 1: linear (C < 1) r > 1: super linear r = 2: quadratic .
